# nestr

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
<!-- badges: end -->

```{r}
library(nestr)
```

```{r}
nest_in(1:3, 
        1 ~ 3,
        . ~ 1)
```






For those who want to stay within the tidyverse framework, this is in fact doable just using `dplyr` and `tidyr`. 

```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
data.frame(x = 1:3) %>% 
  mutate(y = case_when(x==1 ~ list(1:3),
                       TRUE ~ list(1:2))) %>% 
  unnest_longer(y)
```

The semantics are less direct, however and chaining of nesting structure is cumbersome.
